basics.summary: I am a PhD student in Statistics at the University of British Columbia. I completed an MSc in Statistical Science at the University of Oxford, where I worked on conditional diffusion models for structure-based drug design, and a BSc in Mathematics and Statistics at the University of Victoria focused on statistical methodology. My research interests include variational inference, Bayesian optimization, and uncertainty quantification, with applications in drug discovery.

education.summary: Supervisor: Dr. Geoff Pleiss. Co-President of the Statistics Graduate Student Association (SGSA).
Dissertation on conditional diffusion models for structure-based drug design. Supervisor: Dr. Garrett M. Morris.
